roleset.name: remove supply, as with electricity
roleset.note: DISCHARGE-V NOTES: If other senses occur (but I doubt they will) refer to 'charge'. (from discharge.01-v)

example.name: discharge-v: zap
example.text: In all, the company hopes to repay $45 million in debt through the sales, which *trace* will completely discharge its secured debt, the company said.

roleset.name: to release, release from a location (not stuff being released itself)
roleset.note: DISCHARGE-V NOTES: Based on usage in Clinical Questions corpus. Framed by Anwen Feb 2011. (from discharge.101-v)
DISCHARGE-N NOTES: Based on frame for discharge-v.101. Framed by Anwen March 2011. (from discharge.01-n)

example.name: discharge-v
example.text: Dr. Gupta discharged Patient Johanssen from the ICU this morning

example.name: discharge-v
example.text: Patient Dorothy was discharged following a checkup.

example.name: discharge-n: Arg1
example.text: The patient's discharge was given three days after his surgery.

example.name: discharge-n: Arg1 and Arg2
example.text: The patient received his hospital discharge three days after surgery.
